definitions: single-channel audio recording without stereo separation or depth
viral infection causing fatigue, fever, and swollen lymph nodes
examples: The Beatles' early albums were originally released in mono format
Collectors seek original mono pressings for their unique sound mix
She missed three weeks of school after being diagnosed with mono
Mono spreads through saliva, earning it the nickname kissing disease

definitions: visual display or image using only shades of one color
artistic style employing variations of a single color throughout
examples: The old computer monitor could only display monochrome green text
Modern photographers sometimes choose monochrome for dramatic effect
The artist's monochrome paintings explored subtle variations in blue
Gallery visitors admired the powerful simplicity of her monochrome works

definitions: circular lens worn in one eye held by facial muscles
examples: The Victorian gentleman adjusted his monocle to read the newspaper
His monocle dropped into his champagne glass with surprise

definitions: cultivation of single crop species over extensive area repeatedly
society or organization dominated by single shared culture or viewpoint
examples: The farm's corn monoculture depleted soil nutrients over time
Scientists warn that agricultural monoculture increases vulnerability to pests
Corporate monoculture stifles creativity and diverse thinking patterns
The university aimed to break academic monoculture through international recruitment

definitions: practice of having single spouse or sexual partner at one time
examples: Many bird species practice lifelong monogamy with their mates
Modern society generally expects monogamy in marriage relationships

definitions: design of interwoven letters typically representing person's name or organization
examples: The bride ordered towels embroidered with their wedding monogram
His leather briefcase bore an elegant gold monogram

definitions: detailed written study on single specialized subject or aspect of it
examples: The professor published a monograph on medieval manuscript illumination
Her monograph became the definitive work on butterfly migration patterns

definitions: person who speaks or uses only one language fluently
examples: Most Americans remain monolingual despite globalization increasing language demands
The monolingual tourist struggled to communicate in the foreign market

definitions: large single upright block of stone serving as monument
massive uniform and indivisible organization or structure perceived as unchangeable
examples: The ancient monolith stood mysteriously in the desert landscape
Archaeologists dated the carved monolith to the Bronze Age
The corporate monolith resisted all attempts at reform
Critics viewed the government bureaucracy as an impenetrable monolith

definitions: extended speech by single person in drama or conversation
examples: The actor delivered Hamlet's monologue with passionate intensity
Her dinner monologue about work problems lasted thirty minutes

definitions: exclusive control of commodity or service in particular market
property trading board game where players buy and develop real estate
examples: The company's monopoly on internet services faced antitrust investigation
Government regulations aim to prevent harmful monopolies from forming
The family played Monopoly every Sunday evening for hours
She always bought Park Place and Boardwalk in Monopoly

definitions: railway system with trains running on single rail or beam
examples: The city's monorail system connects the airport to downtown
Tourists rode the monorail through the wildlife park

definitions: doctrine or belief that there is only one God
examples: Judaism introduced monotheism to the ancient polytheistic world
The three Abrahamic religions share fundamental monotheism

definitions: sound or speech continuing on one note without variation
examples: The professor's monotone lecture put half the class to sleep
She recited the poem in deliberate monotone for effect

definitions: lack of variety causing weariness through unchanging routine or repetition
examples: The monotony of factory work drove him to seek new employment
She broke the monotony of daily commutes with audiobooks

definitions: oxide containing one oxygen atom in its molecule
examples: Carbon monoxide from the faulty heater posed serious health risks
The chemistry student learned to identify various monoxide compounds

definitions: seasonal wind in South Asia blowing from ocean to land
period of heavy rainfall accompanying the seasonal wind system
examples: The monsoon brings vital moisture to agricultural regions
Farmers eagerly await the annual monsoon for crop irrigation
The monsoon season flooded streets and disrupted transportation
Tourists avoid India during the intense monsoon months

definitions: imaginary creature typically large, frightening, and bizarre in appearance
person of extreme cruelty or wickedness
thing of extraordinary or overwhelming size
examples: Children checked under beds for monsters before sleeping
The movie featured a monster emerging from the deep ocean
The dictator was remembered as a monster who tortured thousands
History judges those monsters who commit genocide harshly
The storm became a monster hurricane with sustained winds
They caught a monster fish weighing over two hundred pounds

definitions: thing that is outrageously evil, wrong, or absurd in nature
something excessively large, ugly, or misshapen in physical form
examples: The abandoned factory became an architectural monstrosity
Critics called the sculpture a monstrosity of bad taste
The new law was a monstrosity that violated basic rights
Such treatment of refugees is a moral monstrosity

definitions: picture made by combining several separate images into one
filmmaking technique of editing together short shots in sequence
examples: The artist created a montage of family photographs
The memorial wall displayed a montage of victims' faces
The training montage showed months of preparation in minutes
Directors use montage to compress time and convey emotion

definitions: period of approximately thirty days as division of year
examples: She pays rent on the first day of each month
The project deadline is exactly one month from today

definitions: magazine or periodical published once every month
examples: She subscribed to several fashion monthlies for trend updates
The scientific monthly published groundbreaking research articles

definitions: structure erected to commemorate person, event, or achievement
outstanding enduring achievement or example serving as lasting evidence
examples: The war monument honors soldiers who died in battle
Tourists photographed the ancient monument at sunset
Her research stands as a monument to scientific dedication
The novel remains a monument of twentieth-century literature

definitions: orange tabby cat character from comic strip created by Jim Davis
James A. Garfield, twentieth president of the United States
examples: Garfield loves lasagna and hates Mondays in the comics
Children watch Garfield cartoons on Saturday mornings
President Garfield was assassinated after only months in office
Garfield served as a Union general before becoming president

definitions: circular or hanging decoration made of flowers, leaves, or other materials
surname, notably of actress Judy Garland
examples: Wedding guests hung garlands of roses around the reception hall
The Christmas garland draped beautifully over the fireplace mantel
Judy Garland starred as Dorothy in The Wizard of Oz
The Garland family attended the memorial service together

definitions: fortified military post where troops are permanently stationed
body of troops stationed at particular location for defense
examples: The garrison protected the strategic mountain pass for centuries
Supplies arrived weekly at the remote garrison
The garrison consisted of five hundred trained soldiers
The commander reviewed the garrison during morning inspection

definitions: family name of Siddhartha, founder of Buddhism known as Buddha
examples: Siddhartha Gautama achieved enlightenment under the Bodhi tree
Gautama Buddha's teachings spread throughout Asia over centuries

definitions: knight of King Arthur's Round Table in medieval romance literature
examples: Sir Gawain accepted the Green Knight's mysterious challenge bravely
Gawain appears in numerous Arthurian legends and medieval texts

definitions: coastal territory along Mediterranean Sea bordered by Israel and Egypt
examples: Gaza faces humanitarian challenges due to ongoing regional conflicts
International aid organizations operate programs within Gaza's borders

definitions: gigabit, unit of digital information equal to one billion bits
examples: The network connection speed reached ten Gbit per second
Modern fiber optic cables transmit hundreds of Gbit simultaneously

definitions: counter device that detects and measures ionizing radiation
examples: The technician used a Geiger counter to check radiation levels
The Geiger counter clicked rapidly near the contaminated area

definitions: third astrological sign representing twins born May 21 to June 20
NASA's second human spaceflight program preceding Apollo missions
examples: As a Gemini, she supposedly has dual personality traits
The horoscope predicted good fortune for Gemini this month
Project Gemini tested spacewalking and orbital docking procedures
Gemini missions paved the way for moon landings

definitions: city in Switzerland hosting numerous international organizations and UN offices
examples: Geneva hosts important diplomatic negotiations and peace talks
The Geneva Convention established rules for humanitarian treatment in war

definitions: person from or inhabitant of Geneva, Switzerland
examples: The Genevan diplomat negotiated the international trade agreement
Many Genevans work for international organizations headquartered there

definitions: major port city in northwestern Italy, capital of Liguria region
examples: Christopher Columbus was born in the maritime city of Genoa
Genoa remains one of Italy's busiest commercial ports

definitions: person from Genoa or relating to the Italian city
examples: The Genoese merchants dominated Mediterranean trade routes for centuries
Traditional Genoese pesto uses local basil and pine nuts

definitions: informal shortened form of gentleman, polite or refined man
examples: The old gent tipped his hat to passing ladies
He proved himself a real gent by helping strangers

definitions: southeastern state of United States, capital Atlanta
country in Caucasus region between Europe and Asia
examples: Georgia produces famous peaches and hosts major film productions
Atlanta, Georgia serves as a major transportation hub
The country of Georgia borders Russia, Turkey, Armenia, and Azerbaijan
Georgia declared independence from the Soviet Union in 1991

definitions: person from or relating to Georgia state or country
British architectural style from reigns of Georges I-IV (1714-1830)
examples: Georgian cuisine features unique spices and wine traditions
The Georgian language uses its own distinctive alphabet
The Georgian townhouse featured symmetrical windows and classical proportions
Georgian architecture emphasized balance and mathematical ratios

definitions: person from Germany or of German descent
West Germanic language spoken primarily in Germany, Austria, and Switzerland
examples: The German engineer designed precision automotive components
Many Germans vacation in Mediterranean countries during summer
She studied German to read philosophical texts in the original
German has three grammatical genders and four cases

definitions: branch of Indo-European languages including German, English, Dutch, and Scandinavian
relating to ancient Germanic peoples or their descendants and culture
examples: English evolved from Germanic languages brought by Anglo-Saxon invaders
Germanic languages share common grammatical structures and vocabulary
Germanic tribes migrated across Europe during late antiquity
The museum displayed Germanic artifacts from archaeological excavations

definitions: federal republic in Central Europe, largest economy in European Union
examples: Germany leads European renewable energy technology development
Berlin serves as Germany's capital and cultural center

definitions: prominent Apache leader who resisted Mexican and US expansion
exclamation shouted when jumping or beginning something daring
examples: Geronimo led Apache resistance for over twenty-five years
The museum exhibit featured artifacts from Geronimo's life
Paratroopers traditionally yell Geronimo when jumping from planes
The children shouted Geronimo before jumping into the pool

definitions: George Gershwin, American composer who blended classical music with jazz
examples: Gershwin composed Rhapsody in Blue and Porgy and Bess
The orchestra performed Gershwin's most celebrated compositions

definitions: secret police of Nazi Germany known for brutal suppression methods
examples: The Gestapo arrested resistance members throughout occupied Europe
Historical documents revealed extensive Gestapo surveillance networks

definitions: Pennsylvania town, site of pivotal Civil War battle in 1863
examples: The Battle of Gettysburg marked the Civil War's turning point
Lincoln delivered his famous address at Gettysburg cemetery

definitions: West African nation on Gulf of Guinea, first sub-Saharan colony to gain independence
examples: Ghana exports gold, cocoa, and oil to international markets
Accra serves as Ghana's capital and largest city

definitions: small long-armed ape living in forests of Southeast Asia
examples: Gibbons swing through trees using their extraordinarily long arms
The zoo's gibbon exhibit recreates tropical forest canopy habitat

definitions: British overseas territory on southern tip of Iberian Peninsula
examples: Gibraltar controls the strategic strait between Atlantic and Mediterranean
The Rock of Gibraltar rises dramatically from the sea

definitions: person from or inhabitant of Gibraltar
examples: Gibraltarians voted overwhelmingly to remain under British sovereignty
Many Gibraltarians speak both English and Spanish fluently
